text:
Set in the 1990s, Captain Marvel follows Danvers, an Air Force officer, as she becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes after earth gets involved in a galactic war between alien. The film will also explore the Kree-Skrull War and feature many iconic characters from the comics, including Mar-Vell, Minn-Erva, and Ronan the Accuser.

In June 2018, Feige revealed that Captain Marvel would not be an origin story in the classical sense, but rather an action-adventure film that explores Danvers' past through non-linear storytelling. The film is written by Geneva Robertson-Dworet and directed by Anna Boden and Ryan Fleck, who are known for their work on Half Nelson (2006) and Mississippi Grind (2015), respectively. The movie features a diverse cast, including Brie Larson, Samuel L. Jackson, Ben Mendelsohn, and Jude Law.

Captain Marvel premiered at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, California on February 27, 2019. The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising its action sequences, visual effects, and performances, while others criticized its storytelling, pacing, and character development. Despite this, the film was a commercial success, grossing over $1 billion worldwide and becoming the highest-grossing film of all time to have a female director. A sequel, The Marvels, is scheduled for release in 2023.
